physical_examinations.relevant_findings: White, slightly oval plaques on the buccal mucosa measuring 2 to 3 cm in diameter. Tense bullae, containing clear to slightly cloudy fluid, 3 to 8 mm in diameter on the dorsum of all toes, extending slightly onto the feet; plantar surfaces of the toes and feet; and on fingers and palms. Resolving bullae with minimal overlying erythema and slight hemorrhagic crust on the toes. Resolving bulla approximately 1 cm in diameter on the left knee. Multiple pink-to-tan hyperkeratotic papules, 2 to 3 mm in diameter, on upper thighs and arms.
Normal physical examination with no scarring or visible abnormality of the oropharynx, skin, or nails.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Ten days after the visit, vesicular lesions developed on both feet after wearing new shoes.
The patient did not report additional episodes of oral or cutaneous lesions.
